sn8.3:1.1: At one time Venerable Vaṅgīsa was staying near Āḷavī, at the Aggāḷava Tree-shrine, together with his mentor, Venerable Nigrodhakappa.
sn8.3:1.2: Now at that time Venerable Vaṅgīsa looked down upon other good-hearted mendicants because of his own poetic virtuosity.
sn8.3:1.5: that I look down on other good-hearted mendicants because of my own poetic virtuosity.”
sn8.3:1.6: Then, on the occasion of arousing remorse in himself, he recited these verses:
sn8.3:2.2: Completely abandon the different kinds of conceit!
sn8.3:2.3: Besotted with the different kinds of conceit,
sn8.3:2.4: you’ve had regrets for a long time.
sn8.3:3.1: Smeared by smears and slain by conceit,
sn8.3:3.3: When people slain by conceit are reborn in hell,
sn8.3:3.4: they grieve for a long time.
sn8.3:4.1: But a mendicant who practices rightly,
sn8.3:4.2: winner of the path, never grieves.
sn8.3:4.3: They enjoy happiness and a good reputation,
sn8.3:4.4: and they rightly call him a ‘Seer of Truth’.
sn8.3:5.1: So don’t be hard-hearted, be energetic,
sn8.3:5.2: with hindrances given up, be pure.
sn8.3:5.3: Then with conceit given up completely,
sn8.3:5.4: use knowledge to make an end, and be calmed.”
